name: The Halfsies Dozen
description:
HEY YOU!

I guess you want to order some cookies, huh? This store is kinda mothballed, so if you want some cookies, go to

http://roguebakery.storenvy.com

and check out the Rogue Bakery website http://roguebakery.com for more info about our cookies!

-------------------------------

Halfsies.

Pick half a dozen of one kind of cookie, then pick half a dozen of another kind.

Together, that makes a dozen. I actually had to use a calculator to make sure that was right. Don't judge me.

What's my favorite Halfsies dozen? I do quite like the I'M NOT A SNICKERDOODLE! and Dark Chocolate Chip combo, myself.

Cookie choices:
Milk Chocolate Chunk
I'M NOT A SNICKERDOODLE!
Oatmeal Dark Chocolate Pecan Cherry
Honey Cashew Cranberry
Dark Chocolate Chip
Cornflake Marshmallow Chip

*NOTE: Let me know what your two choices are by including the info when making payment, or emailing me at roguebakery@gmail.com.

name: The I'M NOT A SNICKERDOODLE! BUT I'M IN THE COLUMBUS ALIVE! Dozen
description:
HEY YOU!

I guess you want to order some cookies, huh? This store is kinda mothballed, so if you want some cookies, go to

http://roguebakery.storenvy.com

and check out the Rogue Bakery website http://roguebakery.com for more info about our cookies!

-------------------------------

To celebrate the I'M NOT A SNICKERDOODLE! being featured as one of the "Things Rebecca Zimmer Loves" in the November 18th issue of the Columbus Alive [http://bit.ly/dtLT7p], here's a chance for you to have a taste of this cookie. I mean, are you going to take her word for it…? ;)


I'M NOT A SNICKERDOODLE! is a very…misunderstood cookie. It's not a Snickerdoodle. It kind of resembles one, but that is the only thing it has in common with it. The biggest difference is that there is no cinnamon in the cookie. None at all. Instead, it incorporates brown sugar, creamy butter, and real vanilla beans, creating a crisp exterior and soft interior, with caramel overtones. 

It also has these little sugar sprinkle crystals on top. I like those. They're pretty. Ooooo...pretty.

name: The Cookies With Benefits Halfsies Dozen [Gluten-free & Vegan]
description:
HEY YOU!

I guess you want to order some cookies, huh? This store is kinda mothballed, so if you want some cookies, go to

http://roguebakery.storenvy.com

and check out the Rogue Bakery website http://roguebakery.com for more info about our cookies!

-------------------------------

At Rogue Bakery, we put taste above anything else. We know there's a stigma with anything Gluten-free or Vegan. But I'm telling you, these are good. Really good. These cookies are the result of 6 months of baking experimentation. Why did Rogue Bakery create them? To jump on the Vegan/Gluten-free bandwagon? Hell no. The only reason is because someone I care about could not have any Rogue Bakery cookies because of her allergies. [Her name is Susan, and here are shameless plugs to her blog (http://www.imageswritten.biz/) and Twitter (http://twitter.com/susellwrites)] Honestly, if these didn't sell at all, it wouldn't matter, because they were made exclusively for Susan. Awwww. :)

The Cookies

Chocolate Liberator: A cookie that gives you the best of both worlds. It's a rich and dark chocolate crinkle-like cookie with one difference: it doesn't get rock hard. I know, sometimes you want things to be rock hard. But this one stays soft and chewy. Also, it tastes and looks just like a normal cookie, so guests won't know what it really is…?

Ancho Chili Peanut Butter: The main ingredient is Columbus's own Krema Nut Company natural creamy peanut butter…laced with freshly ground roasted ancho chili peppers. But as with all Rogue Bakery cookies, there's more to it than that. A hint of lime and coriander hit your palette long before you feel the mild burn of the peppers. You'll recognize this cookie out of a line-up: it's branded with an X on top.

You'll get 6 of each cookie. 6 + 6 = 12, and that's a dozen!
